definition: to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: Get a book of positive , inspirational thoughts and keep it by your desk or by your pillow. Read one or two passages each day.
sentences.chinese: 桌上或案头摆放着一本励志书，每天都去朗读一两段。

sentences.english: C. Read the text in different roles. Find the answers.
sentences.chinese: 小组内分角色朗读对话，寻找答句。

sentences.english: Read the text with your parter, then act it out.
sentences.chinese: 小组合作分角色朗读课文。

sentences.english: We should read English aloud every morning .
sentences.chinese: 我们应该每天早晨朗读英文。

sentences.english: The large images and uncomplicated layouts enhance the read-aloud potential.
sentences.chinese: 大图像和简单的布局，提高朗读的潜力。

sentences.english: He would certainly have done more justice to simple and elegant prose.
sentences.chinese: 他一定善于朗读质朴风雅的散文。

sentences.english: I know that I was always scared to death of reading in front of the class.
sentences.chinese: 我以前最怕在全班同学面前朗读。

sentences.english: These letters seem to be meant to be read out loud.
sentences.chinese: 这些书信似乎需要大声朗读出来。

sentences.english: A. Listen to the tape, read P61(words) to your partner and write these words twice.
sentences.chinese: 听录音，朗读P61单词给搭档听，并抄写两次。

sentences.english: Lsten to the recording. Read aloud and learn by heart the following 10 sentences.
sentences.chinese: 反复听，大声朗读并背熟下面的10个句子。

sentences.english: Repeat the dialogue. → Read the dialogue in roles in groups.
sentences.chinese: 小组内分角色朗读课文，强化语言的交际性。

sentences.english: My teacher had just asked me to read some text out loud.
sentences.chinese: 我的老师刚刚让我大声地朗读课文。

sentences.english: Now, please read the text by yourselves in different roles.
sentences.chinese: 接下来就请同学们分角色朗读课文。

sentences.english: Then, she reads it again in Spanish.
sentences.chinese: 之后，她又用西班牙语朗读了一遍。

sentences.english: Those portions superceded by amendments will not be read.
sentences.chinese: 我们不会朗读那些被修正案取代的部分。

sentences.english: I want you to do some play-reading in groups.
sentences.chinese: 我要你们分组做一些剧本朗读练习。

definition: to read aloud with expression/to recite/to declaim
(of a pupil) to write down (in a dictation exercise)/dictation/(music) to transcribe by ear
to read aloud/to recite rhythmically/to chant/to intone (esp. poems in rhythm)
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
(of a singer etc) excellent in voice and expression (idiom)
